density.note: Ethanol is less dense than water; alcoholic drinks often float ingredients

specificHeat.note: Lower than water (4.186 J/g°C); heats up and cools down faster

thermalConductivity.note: Poor thermal conductor compared to water (0.6 W/(m·K))

latentHeatOfVaporization.note: Much lower than water (2257 kJ/kg); evaporates easily, creating cooling effect

latentHeatOfFusion.note: Energy required to melt frozen ethanol at -114°C

volumetricExpansionCoefficient.note: Expands significantly with temperature; much more than water

antoineCoefficients.note: Predicts vapor pressure of ethanol; high vapor pressure = evaporates easily

viscosity.note: Slightly more viscous than water (0.89 mPa·s)

surfaceTension.note: Much lower than water (72 mN/m); forms flatter droplets

electricalConductivity.note: Very poor conductor; pure ethanol is nearly an insulator

flammability.note: Highly flammable; vapors can ignite at room temperature
